title: What is the senior high school math curriculum for an average US state? - Quora

response.answer_text: It all depends on the state, the county, and the school. I live in Alachua County, Florida and I am currently taking MCR (math for college readiness). Other options for seniors are: Stats (regular, honors, and AP)Calculus (honors and AP, calc bc)Pre-calc (honors)Alg 1 (if the senior doesn’t have the credit)Geometry (if the senior doesn’t have the credit)Alg 2 (if they need it)Libral ArtsMCRKeep in mind the only math class here that only seniors are allowed to take is MCR. Some people stop taking math because they don’t need the credit, and the only two everyone taking are both algebra's.

I'm a senior in high school and I'm taking discrete mathematics (HL Mathematics II, IB). My peers are taking the following: AP BC Calculus, AP AB Calculus, IBSL Math II, and pre-calculus. The curriculum, overall, touches on integrals, limits, probability, statistics, etc.
